db:abstract.db:para: Configures the target binary's name to include an architecture-specific suffix.

db:note.db:para: This command is in technology preview and may change in future releases.
This command should only be called if targeting the Android platform.

db:section.db:title: Description
db:section.db:para: The CMake SUFFIX target property controls the suffix used on the file name of the target's built binary. This command is a convenience for setting that property to an architecture-specific value. This is useful when installing multiple builds for different Android architectures into the same install location, as it prevents the libraries for different architectures from overwriting each other.
